===Etymology===
Various theories exist.
* Possibly an alteration from {{m|ja|反鼻|tr=hanbi}}, an obsolete term for a kind of Chinese medicine made from the skin and/or organs of certain venomous snakes.
* More likely, may be an alteration from {{m|ja|蛇|tr=hebi||snake}}. Some dialects distinguish between non-poisonous ''hebi'' and poisonous ''habi''.
* Possibly also related to, or influenced by, {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はぶ}}-derived verb {{m|ja|食む|tr=hamu||to bite}}. An {{IPAchar|/m/}} - {{IPAchar|/b/}} alternation can be found in some Japanese words, so a shift from ''hamu'' to ''habu'' is a reasonable possibility. The standard modern Japanese word ''hebi'' for “snake” may similarly be derived from, or have been influenced by, ''hamu'' “to bite”.
The kanji spelling {{lang|ja|波布}} is an example of [[ateji]], with the characters chosen purely for their phonetic values.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|本波布|ほんはぶ}}, {{ja-l|ホンハブ||hon habu}}: the “real” or “true” ''habu''
* {{ja-r|ハブ属|ハブぞく}}: the [[genus]] {{taxlink|Protobothrops|genus|noshow=1}}<!-- Wikispecies and WP are confusing -- are Trimeresurus and Protobothrops the same thing? How this term is or was used is an empirical matter-->
* {{ja-r|波布草|はぶそう}}: {{taxlink|Senna occidentalis|species|noshow=1}}, also called [[coffee senna]] or {{vern|coffeeweed}}, a wide-ranging tropical plant with seeds sometimes used for a beverage similar to coffee
* {{ja-r|波布茶|はぶちゃ}}: a [[beverage]] made by [[roast]]ing [[senna]] seeds and [[steep]]ing in water
{{der-bottom}}
